page.title: 20Gardens in Scarborough
page.content: The{gardens}in Scarborough are mainly located on the{South-Cliff.}These are the{Shuttleworth Braille garden,}the {Italian garden,}and the{Esplanade} {gardens.}The{Shuttleworth miniature {garden}is used by blind people.All the plants have{Braille labels}on them so that the{blind}can read them and tell what they are. The{Italian}and the {Esplanade}gardens are both ornamental and used mainly by old people walking round looking at the plants. The gardens also have{pools}with{goldfish} and{carp}in them.The{Shuttleworth } garden has a pool with a miniature boathouse and boat.There are also some small foot-bridges over a stream.The gardens are looked after and kept neat by{gardeners}working for the {Scarborough}Council.The plants in the gardens are mainly evergreen so that there is some colour all year round.
